pages.name: Allgemeines zur Kreislaufwirtschaft
pages.title: General information on the circular economy

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Explain the difference between a linear economic system and the idea of a circular economy.
elements.correctAnswer:
Linear economic system: Many raw materials are extracted, products are manufactured, consumed and thrown away. The linear economic system leads to a shortage of raw materials, large amounts of waste and the resulting environmental problems.
Circular economy: The circular economy is characterized by a durable product design that can be repaired. The use of chemicals that are harmful to the environment and health should be avoided and the use of recyclable materials should be prioritized.
In order for products and materials to remain in the cycle, all stakeholders must take the entire cycle into account and act accordingly.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Name the characteristics of circular production.
elements.correctAnswer: Durable, repairable design; no chemicals that are hazardous to the environment or health; safe and recyclable materials

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Name measures for how we can develop our economy into a circular economy.
elements.correctAnswer: Share, reuse, repair, refurbish and recycle
